author.name: Gareth Field
author.summary: a trail runner, developer, coffee lover, and dog dad based out of beautiful downtown New London, Connecticut!

markdownRemark.excerpt: Alright, so, didn‚Äôt get the job ‚Ä¶ didn‚Äôt get this job! Didn‚Äôt get a job in tech yet! Made it through an interview and didn‚Äôt get laughed off, and now with that‚Ä¶
markdownRemark.html:
Alright, so, didn‚Äôt get the job ‚Ä¶ didn‚Äôt get this job! Didn‚Äôt get a job in tech yet! Made it through an interview and didn‚Äôt get laughed off, and now with that matter concluded, as well as the Logoed project, I have a tremendous amount of freedom in this moment! (Language is important! Can‚Äôt change the past, only ourselves in this moment! Allonz-y!)

To table something, the apartment people will need to be dealt with here, as they were not exactly either forthcoming or knowledgable about the emergency updates to the grace period as far as rent goes, but I need to act on the highest priority matters right now, and so I shall!

So there‚Äôs like three pieces here, what to work on, getting applications out there, and community involvement.

Back to front, community involvement. Just waded through the Reactiflux Discord, definitely worth being on there, the help sections are invaluable, it‚Äôs good for mental health to be able to chat with folk, and the jobs section is always active. Twitter, too, same, always seeing hot tips, hot takes, and hot jobs there. I‚Äôd love to start a New London JavaScript meetup when things get a little bit back to normal, so that‚Äôs something to plan for. Also, involvement in Open Source is a great way to learn and looks good on the resume.

Then job applications. I‚Äôve got a few lists/places to look, so I thought what I‚Äôd do would be to put together a list of jobs that I‚Äôd really like, places I‚Äôd really like to work at, all that jazz, and then make a list of jobs I could maybe fit at, places I‚Äôd maybe like to work at, all that jazz, and then make a list of jobs that were definite maybes, so to speak, and then start with the definite maybes, and then by the time I get to the jobs I‚Äôd really like, I‚Äôm a tech-application-filling-outer pro, and I‚Äôll be very likely to actually apply to the whole list that way. I remember when I was a kid and got sugary cereal with marshmellows, I‚Äôd eat all the non-marshmellow bits first so basically I‚Äôd end up with candy at the end. Nutritionally questionable, but a sign of good planning skills and self-motivation from an early age! üòÜ

Okay, what to work on is an interesting question. Totally valid to polish up the Logoed project, but it would be really nice to have a break from that. Then there‚Äôs my website, it‚Äôs definitely starting to be a little painful both updating it because I‚Äôm not sure exactly what‚Äôs changing between builds, and now I know how to use git diff! Also painful just looking at it, it‚Äôs pretty horrific, lol. There‚Äôs also a few small things I‚Äôd like to do with React Native, one is the splash screen issue in RN60+, and also getting down the flex: 1, vs display: flex; thing, might go through FlexBox Froggie and throw some penguins in there and build it in React and React Native. Speaking of penguins, there‚Äôs games to be built, that‚Äôs always fun! There‚Äôs also Run Club, kinda no better time to work on that, too! (And the other machine is upgrading to Catalina!)

As far as what I do today, I think I‚Äôll go back up that list, work on some code for a while, work on applications for a while, and keep thinking about community stuff throughout, staying on Reactiflux and looking out for any open source libraries that need help along the way. Okay go!

Splash60Plus, init! I was so annoyed that I (totally my fault) broke the whole app I was working on trying to get that one bit of polish, when like it‚Äôs the first impression, and surely other people are doing this too. To Google! Ooh, or to GitHub!

Okay, this repo is massive, wtf, and this wasn‚Äôt updated after 2018, but resource 1 is (Rohit Sharma‚Äôs epic Documentation Repo)[https://github.com/rohit120582sharma/Documentation/wiki/React-Native-~-Splash-Screen#create‚Äîadd-splash-screen-in-rnn] he says in (another part)[https://github.com/rohit120582sharma/Documentation/wiki/React-Native-~-Application-Architecture] that he‚Äôs using react-native-splash-screen ‚Ä¶ I don‚Äôt see that he goes into it any more than linking to the library though, and I don‚Äôt know what version of RN he‚Äôs on ‚Ä¶ What a wiki though! Holy moley!

Oh, okay, first hit in the code tab, I don‚Äôt know where in the tree this is, but it‚Äôs an Infinite Red starter (ACR Talk)[https://github.com/jamonholmgren/acr-talk/tree/c9ad09522caa27f8b89e820c8afad041f0eef5f2/AcrReactNative] ‚Ä¶ RN 0.60.5 and react-native-splash-screen 3.1.1 ‚Ä¶

Splash60Plus under source control, LOL. Oh, build failed off the bat, lol! Right, on-device testing needs provisioning ‚Ä¶ Signing and Capabilities > Team > TrailCity Inc. (heh ‚Ä¶ ehh ‚Ä¶) ‚Ä¶ Building ‚Ä¶ Building ‚Ä¶ Yay it runs. I need to put myself together and walk Dawa again now before trying Android, because it‚Äôs not showing up in adb devices and I don‚Äôt remember what I did to get this working. It‚Äôs not kill-server, it‚Äôs not turning debugging off and on again. USB driver? Anyway ‚Ä¶ lol, so before I go, I tried another cable, and that worked! ü§£ And I‚Äôm going to assemble job listings while walking Dawa rather than just listening to a podcast or music or whatever! To the future! //

OOOHHKAY SO: HELLO EXHAUSTION. It‚Äôs still pretty brisk out, and I just walked around the block for multiple hours going through job listings. (Candor.co)[candor.co] is great, but wow ‚Ä¶ so much ‚Ä¶ so cold ‚Ä¶ ow my back and shoulders from holding the phone. Let‚Äôs count ‚Ä¶ because I‚Äôm still in the ‚ÄòA‚Äôs ‚Ä¶

Actually, starting with the ShopTalk Show listings, actually, 21 listings, 4 were no longer hiring, 1 I couldn‚Äôt tell, two were for other specialties (backend, data vis,) 5 were for senior roles, 3 had specific requirements in terms of experience/portfolio, 2 were Tier One choices (yay!), 1 was Tier Two, there was a support role, and one started off with ‚ÄúWe have a passion for the Church ‚Ä¶‚Äù ‚Ä¶ yea.

Ahhh, there are dozens left still in the ‚ÄòA‚Äôs!!! So this site says either ‚ÄúHiring‚Äù, ‚ÄúNot Hiring‚Äù, ‚ÄúMixed Accounts‚Äù, or ‚ÄúLayoffs‚Äù and updates live, which is awesome, but most of the postings don‚Äôt have links, so Googling every company, trying to find their careers page, going through their job listings, and most of the time it not being a developer position or being for a senior role has been totally exhausting on mobile. Now I‚Äôm back to my computer, this might be a little faster ‚Ä¶ going to try to get through the ‚ÄòA‚Äôs ‚Ä¶ //

Oh my gosh, it‚Äôs 5:30, and I got through the ‚ÄòA‚Äôs on that last walk with Dawa. At least I stopped writing down every one where it wasn‚Äôt going to work. If I kept going at that same rate, it‚Äôd take me two weeks just to go through them, so obviously that‚Äôs not right. Also there are other sources, like AngelList, keeping up with Discord and the React subReddit, and there‚Äôs Hiring React Native ‚Ä¶ I think I need to focus on being a full-stack dev with React, React Native, and Node, and see if I can produce some work that‚Äôs a little more polished. Run Club was actually pretty far along before I stopped working on it ‚Ä¶ and I need some sort of process here of continuing with all of this, or I‚Äôm going to lose it. Like procedurally, because what I‚Äôm trying to do is complicated, and mentally, like ‚Ä¶ deep breaths, here. The dog and the cold and the financial stress and the pandemic compounding everything, I‚Äôm a little on edge here.

Done with job stuff for now though. Where was I with dev stuff? I should power through, tonight. Android build failed with either a gradle thing, a path thing, or a network thing. Try the build again, lol.

Oh you know what I just thought of? My sister said sometimes artists need help with websites, I should look for art that has art as the subject, and do some photoshopping, that would be funny.

‚Ä¶ My dog decided that dinner was acceptable with a little cheese sprinkled on top. Hooray. üêï

No, running droid again did not fix the problem. Probably rules out network. Let‚Äôs see if Android Studio can do any magic here. Checking path is next. // Wait ‚Ä¶ connect timed out? I‚Äôm two feet from the router, what‚Äôs happening? Okay, I just edited the global gradle properties and comment out the proxt lines as per (stack overflow)[https://stackoverflow.com/questions/42516117/android-studio-gradle-sync-failed-connection-timed-out-connect,] and my dog is whining at me. Yeap. Really glad the app built, on our way out, lol. // Aight, well, global WTF WAS THAT?!? ‚Ä¶ That was Camille, dropping Bella‚Äôs leash and freaking out, at the same time as whatever is happening upstairs was happening, so I thought Camille had fallen again or something.

Aight, well, global gradle.properties, comment out the proxy lines. Git commit. git checkout -b acr ‚Ä¶ yarn add react-native-splash-screen ‚Ä¶ todo myself on learning react-native-dotenv ‚Ä¶ oh boy, so I need to todo myself on learning how they do this whole thing. The gist is that they‚Äôre calling setUpRootStore in a useEffect(()=>{stuff},[]) in app.tsx, and stuff sets rootStore as state, and if !rootStore, return null, and they‚Äôre only calling hide on the splash screen in storybook mode. I wonder if it‚Äôs because there‚Äôs a rerender caused by the state changing that negates the need to do so explicitly? Let‚Äôs go with that, for now.

Oh, wait, it wasn‚Äôt just the react-native-splash-screen readme that got me there last time, it was (this article from Spencer Carli!)[https://medium.com/handlebar-labs/how-to-add-a-splash-screen-to-a-react-native-app-ios-and-android-30a3cec835ae] Okay, now I have two sources at least, one that I can trust that it works because it‚Äôs RN60+ and Infinite Red, and the other because Spencer Carli and I‚Äôd actually followed it before back in 2017 or 2018, but understanding what‚Äôs really going on here needs a clearer head than mine right now, except for food, hygeine, and other essentials, I haven‚Äôt stopped for more than twelve hours, and I‚Äôm like done-zowski here. I wish I could just go and go and go. Maybe when I‚Äôve got everything more dialed in, my ankle is better, Dawa and I can train up midday and the endorphins (todo link to that post) are flowing, I‚Äôll be able to crank out 14, 15, 16 hours of really good work in a day. I‚Äôm looking forward to it. For now, my back hurts, I‚Äôm exhausted, Dawa and I are going to get another run in tomorrow, probably another something close to 3 or 4 miles since he hasn‚Äôt been trained enough recently (entirely my fault,) and Lord have mercy.

Best wishes, ~g

P.S. Did I add react-native-splash-screen AFTER checkout -b? silly goose ‚Ä¶

frontmatter.title: C'Est La Vie En Gare!
frontmatter.description: Such is life at the train station!
